title: Mehreen Faruqi’s Lawyers Urge Court To Consider Pauline Hanson’s “Hatred” Towards Muslims | 10 News
description: Lawyers for Greens Senator Mehreen Faruqi have told a court that Pauline Hanson's years of hatred and hostility to Muslims must be taken into account in a legal fight over racist language. Senator Hanson is appealing a federal court ruling that she broke the law when she told the Greens Senator to go back to Pakistan. title: Commonwealth Bank Forecasts RBA Will Keep Cash Rate On Hold In 2026 | 10 News
description: Mortgage holders hoping the new year may bring some much-needed cost-of-living relief could be in for a rude shock. The head of Australia's biggest bank is warning interest rates may stay on hold for all of 2026. The CEO's of Commonwealth Bank & Westpac were grilled in Canberra, with the Housing crisis front and centre. title: Coloured Play Sand Contaminated With Asbestos Identified In 300 Schools | 10 News
description: The number of school sites contaminated with asbestos has doubled, and the Premier warns there's no doubt more to come. While multiple agencies are responding to the crisis, questions are being asked about the extent of possible issues in private child care centres across South Australia. title: Remembering Holocaust Survivor Jack Meister | 10 News+
description: 97-year-old holocaust survivor, Jack Meister, has passed away. Jack was just 11 when German troops invaded his native Poland, and by age 13 he found himself alone before the gates of Auschwitz.  At 17 Jack’s camp was liberated and he emigrated to Australia in 1949 and for the last 30 years, he was a much-loved weekly speaker at the Sydney Jewish Museum.  We loved having Jack on 10 News+ to share his remarkable story and extend our condolences to his family and loved ones. For the full story, click the link in bio. title: Jess Wilson Becomes First Woman In History To Lead Victorian Coalition | 10 News
description: Jess Wilson has become the first woman to lead the Victorian Coalition, succeeding Brad Battin. The call comes after a divided vote from the Liberal Party over whether to spill the leadership. Wilson says her focus will be on the escalating crime crisis in the states, as well as the brutal housing crisis. title: The Kid Laroi’s New Single Sparks Fan Buzz Over Who It’s About | 10 News
description: At just 22, The Kid Laroi is one of Australia’s most successful recording artists, and now he has a brand-new song off a soon-to-be-released album. It’s called “A Perfect World”, and fans are taking to social media to give their thoughts on whether the R&B tune is about his former girlfriend, singer Tate McRae. title: Oscar Piastri’s Mum Accepts Huge Award On F1 Legend’s Behalf | 10 News+
description: There are many proud mums out there, but Nicole Piastri, mum to Australia’s fastest driver, F1 legend, Oscar Piastri, might just be the proudest of them all. Last night, Nicole, alongside Oscar’s dad, Chris, was in Melbourne as he was honoured with the Don award, Australia’s top sporting gong. description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – there are delays at major airports across Australia after internal communications equipment for Air Services Australia failed, the CSIRO will cut up to 350 full time jobs due to budget cuts, Lachlan Brown has been sentenced to 28 years in prison for killing his ex-girlfriend Hannah McGuire and why a man could be forced to hand over the $1.25 million worth of gold that was found in his back garden. title: Parents Launch National Safety Campaign After Daughters’ Laos Methanol Poisoning Tragedy | 10 News
description: The parents of the two young women who died after being served drinks laced with methanol in Laos have launched a new initiative to help young people enjoy schoolies safely.  The national campaign provides practical guidance for school-leavers and their parents about the risks of methanol poisoning and what to do if things go wrong.
